caption: I recently enjoyed a delightful lunch at White Garden, and it was truly an unforgettable experience! From the moment I arrived, I was captivated by the serene and picturesque ambiance. The lush greenery and elegant decor created a perfect escape‚Äîideal for a relaxed midday meal.  The menu offered a wonderful array of options, and every dish I tried was an absolute delight. The [specific dish you tried] stood out with its rich flavors and impeccable presentation. Each bite was a testament to the chef's skill and attention to detail.  The staff were exceptional‚Äîattentive, courteous, and genuinely invested in ensuring every guest felt special. The service was prompt without feeling rushed, allowing me to savor every moment of my lunch.  What truly set White Garden apart was its ability to combine great food, impeccable service, and a tranquil atmosphere. Whether you're looking for a peaceful retreat or a sophisticated dining spot, this is the place to be. I can‚Äôt wait to return and explore more of their incredible menu.

Amazing vegetarian classy restuarant. Loved the ambience, service and food. There are lot of vegetarian and jain options available. The quantity is actually not proportional to the price and compared to normal portion in restaurants but can be shared with 2 people. The food and service is worth the price anyways. i really loved the popcorn flavoured drink which was totally new and variety.

I had a family dinner of 4 with one kid last evening. We ordered 1. Cheese naan bombs - these were tiny ones served in 6 had burst of flavour and is definitely a must try. It could hv been bigger in size. 2. Dimsums - It's a loot in this category because this comes with 4 dimsums though the taste was up it's overly priced compared to other places known for dimsums. I would rather recommend to try their Vietnamese roll 3. Nawabi pizza - The dough was super soft and thin loaded with toppings but lacked the depth in flavour. We had to manually season it loads to satisfy our palate. 4. Malai broccoli - This was good and had a slight smokish flavour infused in the malai. We were served with 4 large florets in a plate. 5. Lotus stem - it was not served hot , as the crisps were Little hard. But had good flavour. 6. Subz biryani - it was light and really good in flavour, would highly recommend to end your meal with this savoury.  Overall though the food was good, ambience was great. I would rather 3 as it's overly priced compared to its peers offering the similar ones. Either work on your pricing or portion sizes
Nice presentation, good taste. Have to book the table if you want to go on a weekend. Quick service  though.  Liked the starters a lot,an international appearance to Desi food. All in all good place.

Ambience is bright and refreshing. Food was authentic and very presentable. Dimsum is a must try. Staff were charming and often asked how was food served. Desserts served were not too sweet which made is more enjoyable. Good place for family dinner and some good vegetarian options.

Had a great experience in white garden. The food was a treat to tummy especially desserts , cheese cake. White garden is an excellent spot for anyone who loves vegetarian cuisine with  morden twist. I can't wait to visit again

It was a great experience with everything in the menu throughout the day.  The chats were available at 12 pm which is not seen that often.  The service is well planned.  The service time is good and the food tastes amazing.  The mocktail options are on another level it's almost like there are so many options u come here just to taste them.  The lighting is bright with low music on the background to keep the place aesthetic as well as professional.

Visited a fantastic vegetarian restaurant, and it truly exceeded my expectations! The staff was exceptionally friendly and knowledgeable, offering great recommendations and making us feel great.  The food was extraordinary. I was particularly impressed by the variety of options.  Overall, this vegetarian restaurant is a gem . I highly recommend it. I‚Äôll definitely be returning soon!

I had the pleasure of dining at White Garden Restaurant for dinner, and it was truly an amazing experience! The ambiance was lovely, the service was top-notch, and the food was exceptional. I was thoroughly impressed with the quality and presentation of the dishes.
Good place for veg lovers. The ambiance is good. The prices were little expensive otherwise the food were good. You won't get disappointed.

A lovely place for vegetarian meals. The restaurant is done up tastefully. This is a pure vegetarian restaurant with a wide variety of menu options. Most of the items we tasted were really good. They have valet parking. Service was pretty good too. If you like Asian vegetarian food, this is must try

We went in on a fine Thursday evening for a regular dinner. Abhijit was our server and he was very courteous and the service was good. We ordered Nani ki Nan Bomb, Japanese Style Crispy Lotus Stem and a Desi Swad Pizza. All the items were very good and it was worth a visit. We will visit again !

Lovely restaurant with great food and ambience! This place is good for family & friends!  Did like their food and drinks too! Salad, soup, dessert, Pani puri were great‚Ä¶ But noodles was a little too much saucy, if noodles and sauces were given separately that would have been a good idea! Well overall we had a great time with friends!

Absolutely fantastic experience! The food was nothing short of amazing, especially the Amritsar Kulcha ‚Äì it was simply divine. The place itself had a wonderful atmosphere, making it a must-visit. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy authentic and delicious food!

The people here are so kind and welcoming I loved it The ambience of the place and the vibe is just so good! Although it's just my first time I would definitely recommend this place Plus ITS VEGETARIAN üòÅüòã

Went here with higher expectations, at least for food. Tried Mushroom Soup, Kali Mirch Chaap, California Sushi, Pizza, Paneer starter and Wok Tossed Fried Rice. Sushi was good. Barring that, all were just decent. Nothing great for which you would want to come back.  There is Valet Parking. We spent around ‚Çπ900 per person.  Visited on 23.08.2024 Reviewed on 25.08.2024

I had gone here on a Sunday for lunch. The ambience is serene and the service is top notch. They do fusion vegetarian food and the menu has something for everyone. You can get food from almost any cuisine here.  The food was brought out very quickly even though the place was busy. I would definitely recommend getting the Greenhouse California Sushi roll, Japanese lotus stem and biscoff cheesecake(dish of the day).  White Garden is located on a main road in Kalyan Nagar and is easy to approach. They have valet parking. The staff is very friendly.
Very good food and great service. Food was served quick and overall very friendly staff. Sourab and Vishnu were great hosts! :D
Loved the whole visit, power to more such vegetarian restaurants!! Beautiful and vast menu , food and service lives up to the price and ambiance!! Definitely a worthy visit !

Visited this place for lunch with a friend. I am a non vegetarian and I absolutely loved the food here. Great ambience as well.  There are lot of great options from different cuisines for you to choose from. Service was good.  And to my fellow non vegetarians, don't be skeptical on visiting this place since it's a vegetarian restaurant. Give it a shot. Trust me, you'll like it!

We visited this place on a Sunday evening. Valet parking is available. I would suggest making a reservation before you go. The place was beautiful and ambience was also great. We ordered multiple items and drinks and everything was delicious and presented well. Drinks were also perfect. Staff is sweet and helpful especially Abhijeet. This place is a must go for vegetarians who are open to try new flavours as well.

service and atmosphere is really good.We felt it's on an expensive side , there's nothing you can find below 300/- apart from mocktails because of this we could order  only 1.thepla-300+   /-,3/5 2.vada pav -455/-,3/5 3.rasmalai pull me up-300+ /-,4/5. Please check with the team before you order something by referring the pics or the Google photos as some are not correctly named with the dishes. We wanted something else ended up with something else.I just want to tell the team that it would really be worthy if u can reduce the prices of some dishes as the rate doesn't align with the dish currently.Thank you. attached below are the Rasmali and thepla..Vada pav didn't feel to click bcz of the price

We came here looking at the reviews and must say, the menu card spread does look pretty interesting.  Alas, the food spread - as fancy as they sound - have a sizable lot to do as far as the taste itself and the portion sizes go.  The Kokum-based mocktail was supremely oversweet. They offered to ‚Äúfix‚Äù it. And ‚Äúfix‚Äù they did with some masala floating in this time with a little less ice. Unfortunately, it was pretty much the same sweetness levels. Credits though for taking it off the bill.  Next came the dimsums - which the staff member recommended himself. While the turnaround was quick, the portion sizes for that price certainly takes you by surprise - ‚Çπ425 for 4 piddly steamed veggie balls? Guess it is about time these ‚Äúnice‚Äù places gave its patrons some value (at least increase the size of the dimsums yo!).  The Sicilian pizza was average at best. Trust me, we‚Äôve all had better pizzas somewhere before. But an A for the turnaround again.  The highlight was their ‚Äúsignature‚Äù Mysore Pak cheesecake. I mean it is just a teeny cheesecake with very little leftover Mysore Pak crumbles strewn over it (not to forget the berry coul√©e designs on the plate, to make it appear lux and trending).  Attaching a pic for the reasonable readers amongst you to decide for yourself - am I making it up or some folks really need to do some reflecting? Apologies - we were 1/4th way through when it struck us what we were putting up with. üôÑ  Must say though, the staff are nice and eager to serve. Although must add - despite Google saying they are open until 12:00 AM, they seemed a little rushed. :)

Well - it's a recent addition to Kalyan Nagar - Kammanahalli neighborhood (1 year old - 2023)  Extremely accessible - bang on the outer ring road junction (Royal Concorde School - Kalyan Nagar entrance)  From the flyover towards Hebbal - you can't miss this place üí™üí™  Cosy comfy style surrounding ‚ù§Ô∏èüß°  Completely vegetarian menu üëçüëç  Wide veg collection - large menu - mocktails, soups, salads, starters, main course, desserts etc üëçüëç  Ground & first floor - 120 to 150 seating capacity  Warm & friendly staff üëçüëç  Comfortable ambience - no jarring music ‚ù§Ô∏è aesthetics are good ‚úÖ‚úÖ  Nice greenery around üíöüíö  Tasty food ‚úÖ‚úÖ different types of palate!  *^ Quantity / portion size less üò∞üò∞  Lot of spicy dishes available üå∂Ô∏èüå∂Ô∏è  Timings - 11.00 am to 4.00 pm.& 7.00 to 11.00 on (all days)  ** Waiting time on weekends  Pricing - expensive (‚Çπ1000/- per person easily)  Overall a nice family get-together place to try different cuisines under one roof üòäüëç  üü• MUST TRY ONCE ‚úÖ

This is my absolute favourite restaurant in Bangalore. Ambience is cozy and welcoming, perfect for any occasion. I enjoyed every single bite of meal in White Garden. The food is always fantastic and no matter what I order I am always delighted with my meal! Servers are also great and always efficient, happy and polite. Can‚Äôt wait to return and wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to eat in Bangalore. Do yourself a favor and visit this lovely restaurant. They have the best desserts. Highly recommended dishes: sushi, dimsum, mashroom soup, hummus platter and cheese cakes.

The overall experience is an average.  Food taste: is nothing out of the box or extravagant- it‚Äôs just like any street side starters and mains. What was disappointing was the portion of each dish - especially main course like gravy and rice - it can only serve 1 adult and 1 child. (The gravy portion was so minimal that we could not even enjoy 2 complete roti/naan with it ). (As shown in the picture ) The service was excellent Ambience is simple and clean  Is the hype and price worth the taste and experience ?  I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth it.  Cause taste is the King and White Garden offered nothing but regular food just with some fancy cutlery, small portion serving and extra service charges marked in the bill (by default) .

Overall we had a nice experience at this place! This is the first time I visited this place and had a nice experience. Food is different and tasty, we tried Thupka soup, panner tikka, dragon sushi, penne pasta, pull me off rasamalia. Every item was good!   The staff is very friendly !

Visited this place for dinner with family and would like to say that ambiance and service is great. The only place where it lags is food. We tried 4 dishes and they were average in taste. We ordered cheese rolls and got something like sushi which was little confusing. Taste was better than what i had last time. Pizza was average in taste and not so great. We could not try more things but will say that the place is worth visiting. The place also has few spots which are good for photography and one can get good clicks. Overall it‚Äôs a good place to spent quality time with loved ones. Try getting a seat on 1st floor as ambiance on 1st floor is better.
One of the best place to have vegetarian food in bangalore,  true fine dine with calm and serene atmosphere.  Great service
Its a nice place with quality food, vibrant ambience, and exceptional staff. Highly recommended.

This is a pure vegetarian place.Though I am a non vegetarian I still loved the food,it's taste and presentation. They have a fusion menu and it suits everyone's taste bud.The service is top notch and ambience is too good.

Great ambiance, yummy food, and fast service. Valet parking available.  We were 8 people and tried a variety of soups: Tandoor Zhol Momo Soup, Cream of Mushroom and Almond Soup, and Tom Yum Tom Boy Soup. All the soups were awesome in taste. We'll definitely visit again for the soup.  1. White Garden Signature Chat Board: The taste was good but nothing special. It's the same papdi chaat you can get on the streets at a cheaper price. 2. Hummus Platter: Everyone liked this. My first experience with a hummus platter wasn't great, but after trying it here, I'd give it another shot as it was tasty. 3. Chilli Cheese Onion Rings: Didn't like it. The taste was not good. I wouldn't recommend it. 4. Garlic Bread with Cheese: It was tasty. If you're a fan of garlic bread, this is a must-try. 5. Mock Meat Lollipop: Everyone liked this, but I didn't. I wouldn't recommend it as it lacked taste, and no chutney was provided. 6. Pesto Paneer Pizza:The pizza tasted great. I don't usually eat pizzas except from Domino's, but this one was good. 7. Mock Meat Rogan Josh: Don't try this. It looks like mutton and is not tasty at all. A waste of money. 8. Drinks: We tried Sea Blue, Pina Colada, and Virgin Mojito. Everything was good in taste. 9. Deserts: We tried Ferraro rocher chocolate mousse cake and pull me off rasmalai. Both were good in taste

White Garden in Bengaluru is a haven for vegetarians, offering an impressive variety of veg dishes that cater to all tastes. The ambiance is inviting, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed meal with family or friends.One of the standout items on their menu is the Cheese Golgappa‚Äîa unique twist on the traditional favorite that you absolutely must try. The creamy cheese filling adds a delicious richness to the classic golgappa, creating a flavor experience that‚Äôs both familiar and delightfully new.Whether you‚Äôre a local or just visiting Bengaluru, White Garden is definitely worth a visit. The diverse veg options and innovative dishes make it a restaurant you shouldn't miss!

Starters are good here- 1. Truffle edamame dimsum are very good, all chutneys with it are wonderful üòä. 2. PTM and thepla Tacos are alo good and tasty ü§§. Base thepla was little bit hard. 3. Pinacolada was good . 4. Hongkong sushi üç£ was ok 5. Hammus platter is okay, not that much good.  Service is nice, The place was a little bit noisy due to the crowd.

It's my first visit here and my experience is just average. We are a total of 6 and we didn't wait to be seated. The restaurant was very empty when we went.  The food order was taken promptly by repeating each dish we ordered.  However, they took a very very long time to make a simple Caesar salad and even after asking twice they didn't care for it. No apologies or any sort of is given. When we asked them to cancel, they didn't have any regrets about it.  As for the starters, the lotus stem, soups, sushi & the nachos were good. Dimsum was very creamy.  Special mention to the hummus platter which most of us liked.  We also ordered a few drinks in which mine was too lemony. Virgin pina colada is excellent.  As for the main course we didn't order much but whatever we ordered was good. The thai curry was more creamy and less spicy. The risotto & lasagne was good but there were no condiments provided. The server didn't have any knowledge on those. When asked he simply said it's all extra charge.  The service is too bad. Except for the girl who served us water often without asking, the rest of them were just poor. One has refused to serve when asked. He doesn't know how to talk to your guests.  "Special thanks to the girl". The extra 1 star is for that girl.  Suggestion to the service team. Please learn a few magic words like sorry, thank you, etc. You need this to get more crowds on weekends. But the order taker came to us in the end & asked collectively on how the food & service was. I suggest, that it should be done often when we are eating. Not definitely after we pay the bill.  I'm from Chennai & this would be my first & last visit to this restaurant.  Overall it's just a below average restaurant.
Liked the place. Different varieties for a veg restaurant. Close to Main Road and have wallet parking. Good for lunch or dinner with family and friends.

Visited for family lunch on 6/10/24 .. Lot of crowd .. Had reserved prior .. The best among the dishes ordered was the Farmhouse Pizza .. Soups were good ..Others ok .. Pasta was served like a Gourmet dish .. Big plate with small depression.. small quantity of Pasta .. similarly Vanilla ice cream and Passion Fruit Pannacota .. an overkill..White Garden signature chaat board was a disappointment..Mocktails were ok ..Hummus platter was a let down ..  Points for improvement.. 1. Decrease the ratio of Serving person to tables .. My person was running between tables .. 2. Please put photos of the dishes in the menu.. we can make better choices 3. Trial portions .. so that we can eat more of different dishes .. 4. More of Kannada speaking staff  Points for Accolades.. 1. Vegetarian Hotel 2. Great Pizza 3. Good Staff
We really enjoyed the dinner, rasmalai pull up cake and lasagne were awesome.We had  good service from Akram, sourav and prakash. Mock meat lollipop was crunchy n tasty.
